meanings.definition: A loud, heavy sound, such as that made by a heavy object falling or hitting something.
meanings.sent1: The thumping of the drum echoed through the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard the thumping of footsteps approaching quickly.
meanings.sent3: The thumping of the door made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The thumping of the bass in the music shook the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The thumping of the hammer signaled the start of construction.

meanings.definition: Very large or impressive in size or extent.
meanings.sent1: The thumping book on the shelf caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: She carried a thumping bag full of groceries.
meanings.sent3: The thumping cake towered over the other desserts.
meanings.sent4: The thumping waves crashed against the shore relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The thumping tree in the forest was the tallest I had ever seen.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike heavily, often with a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: He was thumping the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter was thumping the nail into the wood.
meanings.sent3: She was thumping the pillows to fluff them up.
meanings.sent4: The boxer was thumping his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent5: The chef was thumping the dough to prepare the bread.
